title: Radiation Shielding Efficiency in Lunar Simulant

sections.abstract: The experiment benchmarks radiation attenuation factors using compacted lunar regolith simulant.
sections.methods: Lunar simulant slabs were layered with composite polymers and exposed to proton spectra in a vacuum chamber.
sections.results: Composite-regolith laminates reduced proton flux by up to 47% compared to regolith-only shielding.
sections.conclusion: Hybrid shielding strategies combining in-situ resources with lightweight polymers can protect future Gateway crews.
